author: craigmcc
msg: Remove the old populate() method that was commented out.

author: craigmcc
msg: Cosmetic changes only.

author: craigmcc
msg: Refactor and fix BeanUtils.populate() so that it will correctly set
nested properties on DynaBeans.  I did not use the proposed patch (but
thanks anyway!) for two reasons:
- It included "return" statements inside the loop that would have
stopped processing all of the properties in the Map
- It only supported one level of nesting (which was also true of the
old code for standard JavaBeans).
Now, you can have an arbitrarily deep set of nested beans, and these nested
beans can be any combination of DynaBean and standard JavaBean types.
Added test cases for setting nested properties via BeanUtils.populate(), and
verified that all previous test cases continue to work.
PR: Bugzilla #7521
Submitted by:	Anil Mandava <amandava at yahoo.com>

author: rdonkin
msg: Fixed bug 7740. Klaasjan Brand supplied a patch which was very helpful in locating the problem but a slightly different patch was committed mainly for stylistic reasons. Also added extra tests covering the cause of failure. Also corrected another coding mistake (again mea culpa) in the same passage of code.

author: craigmcc
msg: Fix 7333 by making BeanUtils explicitly depend on FastHashMap (from the
commons-collections.jar file) as ConvertUtils and PropertyUtils.  This
means you will get the ClassNotFoundException immediately on your first
reference to the BeanUtils class, instead of it potentially getting masked
or ignored by BeanUtils methods that call ConvertUtils or PropertyUtils.
Submitted by:	Brian.Ewins at btinternet.com
